intro: Pavetta insignis, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy appearance, contributing to its ornamental value.
